original_definition: 'conventional water heater' means a water heater that generates heat using the combustion of fossil and/or biomass fuels and/or the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements;
generated_definition: 'conventional water heater' means a water heater that uses conventional methods, such as electricity or gas, to heat water. also known as a storage water heater, it stores water in a tank and relies on a heat exchanger to transfer heat to the water.

Article 2: ‘conventional water heater’ means a water heater that generates heat using the combustion of fossil and/orbiomass fuels and/or the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements;
